description: From Middle English swiftly, swyftely, swiftliche, from Old English swiftlīċe (“swiftly”), equivalent to swift +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: swiftly (comparative swiftlier or more swiftly, superlative swiftliest or most swiftly)

entries.meaning: In a swift manner; quickly; with quick motion or velocity; fleetly.
